title: The Hundred: Watch best plays as Welsh Fire face Trent Rockets
description: Watch the best action from Monday's women's and men's matches between Welsh Fire and Trent Rockets in The Hundred.

title: Taking a walk through rubbish-laden Edinburgh's Grassmarket
description: Two thirds of Scotland's local authorities have seen bin workers walking out in a dispute over pay.

title: Guinness World Record: Man rides 38 miles in giant pumpkin
description: Duane Hansen grew the 846lb (384kg) pumpkin in his garden with the aim to beat the 25.5 mile record.

title: Ferrari doubt Formula 1's ability to effectively enforce the sport's budget cap
description: Ferrari question the ability of Formula 1's governing body to police the sport's budget cap effectively.

title: Leeds Festival death: Family pay tribute to David Celino, 16,
description: Sixteen-year-old David Celino had just celebrated "fabulous" GCSE results, his family say.

title: Moqtada al-Sadr, dominant Iraqi political leader, retires from politics
description: The step by Moqtada al-Sadr, whose supporters recently stormed parliament, is seen as a major move.

title: New council pay offer made to end strike action in Scotland
description: Two thirds of Scotland's local authorities have seen bin workers walking out with staff at schools and nurseries due to join the dispute next week.

title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Van Dijk, Fernandes, Odegaard, Sterling, Haaland
description: Who got his team out of jail? Who is running things for a title contender? Find out in Garth Crooks' latest Team of the Week.

title: Roger Bolton: Radio 4 Feedback presenter 'would have liked to continue'
description: Roger Bolton told listeners the BBC "decided it was time for me to stand down" from Feedback.

title: Energy bills could break firms, warns ex-chancellor
description: Alistair Darling says the new prime minister must quickly take "bold action" to help with soaring costs.

title: Kenyan cyclist Kangangi dies in crash during US race
description: Kenyan cyclist Suleiman Kangagi dies following a high-speed crash in a race in the United States on Saturday.

title: Royal Navy HMS Prince of Wales breaks down off south coast
description: The HMS Prince of Wales's departure from Portsmouth had already been postponed due to a technical issue.

title: 'Man of the Hole': Last of his tribe dies in Brazil
description: The last member of an uncontacted indigenous group in Brazil had lived in total isolation for decades.

title: MTV VMAs: Taylor Swift announces new album as she wins top prize
description: The singer revealed details about her new record Midnights as she scooped video of the year.

title: Indianapolis: Dutch commando dies after shooting outside US hotel
description: The special forces soldier was one of three Dutch commandos wounded in an attack early on Saturday.

title: Two Air France pilots suspended after cockpit fistfight
description: The cabin crew intervened after hearing noise from the cockpit as two pilots started fighting.

title: EU faces awful winters without gas cap - minister
description: Calls mount for an EU-wide cap on the price of gas and its decoupling from electricity.

title: Spain's olive oil producers devastated by worst ever drought
description: Spain's olive oil industry is in danger after being hit by chronic water shortages.

title: Gibraltar is officially a city - 180 years late
description: The Rock's status was granted by Queen Victoria in 1842, but had been omitted from official records.

title: Leeds Festival: Arctic Monkeys close weekend with huge singalong on UK return
description: The Yorkshire band played songs old and new in front of legion of fans in their home county.
